properties.Title: Freezing Drizzle Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Freezing drizzle will continue through the night and into Thursday morning. ### Freezing drizzle can produce thin, hard-to-detect layers of ice. Freezing drizzle advisories are issued when drizzle falling in sub-zero temperatures is expected to freeze on contact, and over time create icy surfaces. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T14:37:56-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-13T22:38:56-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0274374244.2019
Area: Kluane Lake
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Weather Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Winter Weather Travel Advisory in effect for this evening. Lake effect snow bands are expected to persist through the evening. Travel may be impacted, particularly on Highway 17, due to low visibility in heavy snow at times. Conditions are forecast to improve later this evening. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T06:59:35-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-13T20:31:35-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2406617174.2019
Area: Nipigon - Rossport, Marathon - Schreiber
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Lakes Within Whiteshell Provincial Park
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the lakes within the Whiteshell Provincial Park area due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as levels as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing water or waters of unknown depth. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-11-14T15:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-11-13T15:36:29-06:00, E8570E32-FE19-1083-A663-B3D1B29D5568
Area: Whiteshell Provincial Park
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A moist Pacific front will bring snow to the central Yukon. Snow will begin this evening and intensify on Thursday afternoon. Snow will taper off to a few flurries late Thursday night. Total snowfall accumulation is expected to exceed 20 cm by late Thursday evening. ### Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T15:48:43-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-13T23:49:43-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1834657901.2019
Area: Dawson, Mayo
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Update: High Water Advisory Alert Is Being Issued For The Roseau River From Gardenton To Stuartburn
properties.Summary:
Description: Update: This is a Manitoba Emergency Alert. Manitoba Infrastructure's Hydrologic Forecast Centre has issued a High Water Advisory for the Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn due to expected high flows. If you are in the affected area, be watchful of local waterways as flooding is likely to occur. Do not attempt to cross fast flowing waters or waters of unknown depth. Avoid flooded areas. Follow all directions by the local authorities. Listen for updates and take all necessary precautions to stay safe. Up-to-date information is available at www.gov.mb.ca/flooding and www.manitoba511.ca or stay tuned to local media.
Expires: 2019-11-14T15:30:00-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization, 2019-11-13T15:35:28-06:00, 0F7A6631-256A-E02D-DAC7-A25DAECD0CBE
Area: Roseau River from Gardenton to Stuartburn
properties.Author: Manitoba Emergency Measures Organization

properties.Title: Snow Squall Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Moderate snow squalls occurring tonight. Weak to moderate snow squall bands have developed over the southern Gulf of St. Lawrence and will gradually diminish through the night into Thursday morning, as a ridge of high pressure moves over the Maritimes. Travel under these bands may be hazardous at times due to snow, blowing snow, and strong westerly winds. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow. Snow squall watches are issued when conditions are favourable for the formation of bands of snow that could produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NSstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NSStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T17:59:49-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-14T02:11:49-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2189404722.2019
Area: Pictou County, Antigonish County, Inverness County - south of Mabou, Inverness County - Mabou and north, Victoria County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Lake effect snow squalls this evening and tonight. Lake effect flurries and local snow squalls are expected to continue through Thursday morning. Local snowfall accumulations of 15 to 25 cm will be possible tonight with an additional 5 centimetres possible Thursday before the squalls move out of the area. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T13:20:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-13T21:21:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1954188253.2019
Area: Bayfield Inlet - Dunchurch, Bruce Peninsula - Sauble Beach - Tobermory

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. Maximum gusts: 90 km/h, except 110 along parts of the coast. Locations: Nain and vicinity. Time span: tonight until Thursday morning. ### Damage to buildings, such as to roof shingles and windows, may occur. Loose objects may be tossed by the wind and cause injury or damage. Wind warnings are issued when there is a significant risk of damaging winds. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-14T13:59:54-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-14T02:24:54-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0848009624.2019
Area: Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Lake effect snow squalls possible tonight. Lake effect flurries are expected to continue this evening. Some of these flurries are then expected to intensify into local snow squalls and continue tonight. Areas south and east of Elliot Lake are most likely to see the snow squalls. Local snowfall accumulations of 10 to 20 cm will be possible by the time the snow squalls move east of the region overnight. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T19:26:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-14T03:27:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3805333975.2019
Area: Elliot Lake - Ranger Lake, Blind River - Thessalon
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Lake effect snow squalls continue through tonight. Southerly winds over the relatively warm waters of Lake Superior are producing flurries and local snow squalls which will continue through tonight. Local snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are possible, however areas closer to Lake Superior could see locally higher amounts of 15 to 25 cm. Additional amounts of 5 to 15 cm are possible Thursday morning. Local blowing snow reducing visibilities will also be a concern. The local snow squalls are forecast to taper off when the winds shift to the northwest on Thursday. ### Snow squalls cause weather conditions to vary considerably; changes from clear skies to heavy snow within just a few kilometres are common. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T19:23:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-14T03:24:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3567727614.2019
Area: White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park, Agawa - Lake Superior Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blizzard Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Blizzard conditions with gusty winds and persistent visibility near zero in snow and blowing snow are expected or occurring. Blizzard conditions will develop late this evening and intensify on Thursday. Wind gusts exceeding 100 km/h near the Richardson Mountains with falling snow will produce near zero visibility in blowing snow. Blizzard conditions will abate late Thursday night as winds subside to 30 to 50 km/h. ### Road closures are likely. Blizzard warnings are issued when widespread reduced visibilities of 400 metres or less are expected for at least 4 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T14:50:02-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-13T22:51:02-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4172968832.2019
Area: Dempster

properties.Summary:

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.

properties.Title: Winter Storm Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Hazardous winter conditions are expected. Additional snowfall: 5 to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: up to 120 km/h tonight. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik. Time span: tonight until Thursday morning. Remarks: The snow will be accompanied by strong north to northwesterly winds gusting up to 120 km/h, giving blizzard-like conditions tonight. ### Visibility will be suddenly reduced to near zero at times in heavy snow and blowing snow. Winter storm warnings are issued when multiple types of severe winter weather are expected to occur together. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2019-11-14T11:59:50-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-11-14T02:24:50-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0813008045.2019
Area: Postville - Makkovik, Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Fog Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Near zero visibility in fog is expected or occurring. As a ridge of high pressure continues to hold over the BC Interior tonight, dense fog over the 100 Mile region will persist into Thursday morning. ### Visibility may be significantly and suddenly reduced to near zero. Weather in the mountains can change suddenly resulting in hazardous driving conditions. Road conditions are available at www.drivebc.ca. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm.
Expires: 2019-11-14T15:55:45-00:00
